definition: to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask

sentences.english: Inside the growing -- and very lucrative -- world of virtual currency. (AdWeek)
sentences.chinese: 揭秘日益壮大且利润丰厚的虚拟货币世界。

sentences.english: Scientists in Germany have unveiled the latest self-driven car.
sentences.chinese: 德国科学家揭秘了最新一代的无人驾驶汽车。

sentences.english: The whistle-blowing website Wikileaks is suspending its publication of classified files.
sentences.chinese: 揭秘网站‘维基解密’暂停发布保密文件。

sentences.english: The documents were revealed by the whistle- blowing organization Wikileaks.
sentences.chinese: 这些文件由泄密网站维基揭秘披露。

sentences.english: This article tells how a winery set the price for a bottle of wine.
sentences.chinese: 本文将为您揭秘酒庄是如何给一瓶葡萄酒定价的。

sentences.english: Maybe the WikiLeaks is a way of circumventing those restrictions.
sentences.chinese: 也许通过维基揭秘正好避开了那些分类约束。

definition: to explore a mystery/to probe the unknown
rarely known to anyone (idiom); almost unknown/secret to all but a few
to explain in detail/detailed answer/full solution (to a math problem)
popular science/popularization of science/abbr. of 科學普及|科学普及
to expose/to unmask/to ferret out/to disclose/disclosure

particle indicating that a previously asked question is to be applied to the preceding word ("What about ...?", "And ...?")/particle for inquiring about location ("Where is ...?")/particle signaling a pause, to emphasize the preceding words and allow the listener time to take them on board ("ok?", "are you with me?")/(at the end of a declarative sentence) particle indicating continuation of a state or action/particle indicating strong affirmation
to make an inventory/to take stock
